🎯 TÌM KIẾM CƠ HỘI VIỆC LÀM REMOTE - FULLSTACK DEVELOPERXin chào các anh/chị HR, CTO và các công ty đang tuyển dụng!Mình là Nguyễn Quốc Việt, một Fullstack Developer với hơn 9 năm kinh nghiệm, hiện đang sinh sống tại Hà Nội. Mình đang tìm kiếm một cơ hội làm việc fulltime remote, tập trung vào các dự án phát triển hệ thống web (MERN stack, Laravel, Python/Flask) hoặc các giải pháp ứng dụng AI (OpenCV, YOLO, TensorRT...).🔧 Kỹ năng chính:Ngôn ngữ: Java, Python, C++, PHP, Javascript (ES6, Typescript)Framework: ReactJS, NodeJS, ExpressJS, Laravel, Flask, Spring, HibernateCơ sở dữ liệu: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDBKhác: Docker, Git, REST API, GraphQL, OpenCV, TensorRT, YOLO, Ruby on Rails📌 Kinh nghiệm nổi bật:TPBank: Hệ thống chuyển tiền doanh nghiệp (Java J2EE, Oracle)Rikunabi Japan: Cổng thông tin tuyển sinh thực tập sinh lớn tại NhậtVollmont: Hệ thống giao thông AI – xử lý ảnh, nhận diện xe & biển số (Python/C++)Vistarsoft Insight: Hệ thống quản lý công việc, logtimesheet cho công ty phần mềm (MERN stack)DC Farewell: Dự án quản lý tang lễ tại Mỹ – có livestream và thanh toán trực tuyến (Laravel + ReactTS)✅ Ưu điểm:Giao tiếp tiếng Anh tốt (TOEIC 830)Làm việc nhóm tốt, từng giữ vai trò Team Leader & Project ManagerQuen với Agile/Scrum, DevOps, CI/CDCó kinh nghiệm làm việc cho thị trường Nhật Bản hơn 5 năm💻 Mình mong muốn được tham gia vào một môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp, có tính linh hoạt, và nơi mà kỹ năng kỹ thuật và trách nhiệm cá nhân của mình được phát huy tốt nhất.📩 Nếu anh/chị có cơ hội phù hợp hoặc biết ai đó đang cần, xin hãy kết nối với mình qua:📞 SĐT: +84 339 777 496✉️ Email: [vui lòng cung cấp nếu muốn]🌐 LinkedIn: [có thể gắn link nếu bạn có tài khoản]Cảm ơn anh/chị đã đọc và chia sẻ bài viết này! 🙏hashtag#RemoteJob hashtag#FullstackDeveloper hashtag#ReactJS hashtag#NodeJS hashtag#Laravel hashtag#Python hashtag#AIEngineer hashtag#VietnamDeveloper hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#DeveloperLife

Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. They show up in capacity planning, bad on-call handoffs, and systems nobody understands end to end.This role is different.You will lead incidents. You will build infra from scratch. You will sit side-by-side with engineers and say: “This won’t work at scale—here’s why.”Veeva supports 2M+ users. This is not a toy system. This is real-world complexity. They’re serious about being able to hand off problems without delay. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Available in the US, UK, Brazil, Portugal, Spain, and other European countries. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. They show up in capacity planning, bad on-call handoffs, and systems nobody understands end to end.This role is different.You will lead incidents. You will build infra from scratch. You will sit side-by-side with engineers and say: “This won’t work at scale—here’s why.”Veeva supports 2M+ users. This is not a toy system. This is real-world complexity. You’re expected to handle it.Tech stack includes: → Java → Spring, Hibernate → Kubernetes, Docker → AWS, MySQL → Git, Maven → Bash, Python, GoIt’s remote, but timezone-limited to PST/HST. They’re serious about being able to hand off problems without delay. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Available in the US, UK, Brazil, Portugal, Spain, and other European countries. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. They show up in capacity planning, bad on-call handoffs, and systems nobody understands end to end.This role is different.You will lead incidents. You will build infra from scratch. You will sit side-by-side with engineers and say: “This won’t work at scale—here’s why.”Veeva supports 2M+ users. This is not a toy system. This is real-world complexity. You’re expected to handle it.Tech stack includes: → Java → Spring, Hibernate → Kubernetes, Docker → AWS, MySQL → Git, Maven → Bash, Python, GoIt’s remote, but timezone-limited to PST/HST. They’re serious about being able to hand off problems without delay. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Available in the US, UK, Brazil, Portugal, Spain, and other European countries. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. $3 BILLION dollar question from a desperate CIO of a fortune 500 company with the CEO and founder/President on the call - “In the simplest terms, tell me HOW to fix my data so that everything FIRST works, SECONDLY works in real-time; BI, ERP, and AI?”1. Use a senior business analyst and a team of business analysts to document how your business works into BRD, and FRD. (Business Requirements Documentation, and Functional Requirements Documentation)In the BRD also specifically document your competitive edge, how you stay in business, and innovate. How are you different from or better than your competitors?Specifically document how you collect and use intelligence internally and on your competitors. You need a full competitor intelligence database in addition to internal BI.Also, in the BRD, document legal compliance and regulatory reporting requirements.2. Sign-off and deliver the BRD to me, the enterprise data modeler. I’ll make a data model structure that makes your data compatible with modern software, ERP, BI, AI, and automatically follow how your business works. I’ll create data view GUI, insert GUI for data entry, data update GUI, etc.3. The last step is I and an ETL analyst will Create a repeatable ETL process to extract, transform, and load your data. The data model will automatically import and fix data that can be fixed. Bad data will be quarantined for manual data entry repair.AT THIS POINT YOUR DATA IS FIXED, ERP, BI, and AI ready! Response: “So just formally document everything and hand it to you? That’s it?!”“Yes, that’s it,” I responded. “WELL Why haven’t we already done this?” The President asked the CIO.“Cost!” The CEO interjected.“Cost? What are we looking at?” The President asked.“We got three other estimates 8 years ago.” The CIO resumed. “$6 billion from Xerox, $1 Billion from PWC and IBM, and $2,000,000 from the offshore guys we usually use.”Awkward silence for 4 second…“So what the F happened?” The President asked.The CIO slowly responded, “We took the most cost effective option…”“And went over it by over $100 million,” the CEO interjected. “Well we under estimated the analysis requirements, got to the end of the project, and nothing worked,” the CIO finished.“And the data and performance got ten times worse!” The CEO said.“Well what about that automatic data model thing?!” The predident asked.“We didn’t get that,” the CIO explained. “The cost of just that would have added two or three years and about $3 BILLION to the project according to our analysts.”“As opposed to 8 years, $100 million in project costs, and $48 BILLION in revenue waste,” the CEO interjected. “All before my time, I might add.”Awkward silence, papers rustling…“Where are we bleeding the most money?” the President asked.“Supply chain,” both CEO and CIO answered in unison.“Second and Third?”“Data breaches and legal,” they answered in unison.Awkward silence…“Meet back in 48 hours.”Disconnect beeps…

Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. $3 BILLION dollar question from a desperate CIO of a fortune 500 company with the CEO and founder/President on the call - “In the simplest terms, tell me HOW to fix my data so that everything FIRST works, SECONDLY works in real-time; BI, ERP, and AI?”1. Use a senior business analyst and a team of business analysts to document how your business works into BRD, and FRD. (Business Requirements Documentation, and Functional Requirements Documentation)In the BRD also specifically document your competitive edge, how you stay in business, and innovate. How are you different from or better than your competitors?Specifically document how you collect and use intelligence internally and on your competitors. You need a full competitor intelligence database in addition to internal BI.Also, in the BRD, document legal compliance and regulatory reporting requirements.2. Sign-off and deliver the BRD to me, the enterprise data modeler. I’ll make a data model structure that makes your data compatible with modern software, ERP, BI, AI, and automatically follow how your business works. I’ll create data view GUI, insert GUI for data entry, data update GUI, etc.3. The last step is I and an ETL analyst will Create a repeatable ETL process to extract, transform, and load your data. The data model will automatically import and fix data that can be fixed. Bad data will be quarantined for manual data entry repair.AT THIS POINT YOUR DATA IS FIXED, ERP, BI, and AI ready! Response: “So just formally document everything and hand it to you? That’s it?!”“Yes, that’s it,” I responded. “WELL Why haven’t we already done this?” The President asked the CIO.“Cost!” The CEO interjected.“Cost? What are we looking at?” The President asked.“We got three other estimates 8 years ago.” The CIO resumed. “$6 billion from Xerox, $1 Billion from PWC and IBM, and $2,000,000 from the offshore guys we usually use.”Awkward silence for 4 second…“So what the F happened?” The President asked.The CIO slowly responded, “We took the most cost effective option…”“And went over it by over $100 million,” the CEO interjected. “Well we under estimated the analysis requirements, got to the end of the project, and nothing worked,” the CIO finished.“And the data and performance got ten times worse!” The CEO said.“Well what about that automatic data model thing?!” The predident asked.“We didn’t get that,” the CIO explained. “The cost of just that would have added two or three years and about $3 BILLION to the project according to our analysts.”“As opposed to 8 years, $100 million in project costs, and $48 BILLION in revenue waste,” the CEO interjected. “All before my time, I might add.”Awkward silence, papers rustling…“Where are we bleeding the most money?” the President asked.“Supply chain,” both CEO and CIO answered in unison.“Second and Third?”“Data breaches and legal,” they answered in unison.Awkward silence…“Meet back in 48 hours.”Disconnect beeps…

Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. They show up in capacity planning, bad on-call handoffs, and systems nobody understands end to end.This role is different.You will lead incidents. You will build infra from scratch. You will sit side-by-side with engineers and say: “This won’t work at scale—here’s why.”Veeva supports 2M+ users. This is not a toy system. This is real-world complexity. You’re expected to handle it.Tech stack includes: → Java → Spring, Hibernate → Kubernetes, Docker → AWS, MySQL → Git, Maven → Bash, Python, GoIt’s remote, but timezone-limited to PST/HST. They’re serious about being able to hand off problems without delay. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Available in the US, UK, Brazil, Portugal, Spain, and other European countries. $3 BILLION dollar question from a desperate CIO of a fortune 500 company with the CEO and founder/President on the call - “In the simplest terms, tell me HOW to fix my data so that everything FIRST works, SECONDLY works in real-time; BI, ERP, and AI?”1. Use a senior business analyst and a team of business analysts to document how your business works into BRD, and FRD. (Business Requirements Documentation, and Functional Requirements Documentation)In the BRD also specifically document your competitive edge, how you stay in business, and innovate. How are you different from or better than your competitors?Specifically document how you collect and use intelligence internally and on your competitors. You need a full competitor intelligence database in addition to internal BI.Also, in the BRD, document legal compliance and regulatory reporting requirements.2. Sign-off and deliver the BRD to me, the enterprise data modeler. I’ll make a data model structure that makes your data compatible with modern software, ERP, BI, AI, and automatically follow how your business works. I’ll create data view GUI, insert GUI for data entry, data update GUI, etc.3. The last step is I and an ETL analyst will Create a repeatable ETL process to extract, transform, and load your data. The data model will automatically import and fix data that can be fixed. Bad data will be quarantined for manual data entry repair.AT THIS POINT YOUR DATA IS FIXED, ERP, BI, and AI ready! Response: “So just formally document everything and hand it to you? That’s it?!”“Yes, that’s it,” I responded. “WELL Why haven’t we already done this?” The President asked the CIO.“Cost!” The CEO interjected.“Cost? What are we looking at?” The President asked.“We got three other estimates 8 years ago.” The CIO resumed. “$6 billion from Xerox, $1 Billion from PWC and IBM, and $2,000,000 from the offshore guys we usually use.”Awkward silence for 4 second…“So what the F happened?” The President asked.The CIO slowly responded, “We took the most cost effective option…”“And went over it by over $100 million,” the CEO interjected. “Well we under estimated the analysis requirements, got to the end of the project, and nothing worked,” the CIO finished.“And the data and performance got ten times worse!” The CEO said.“Well what about that automatic data model thing?!” The predident asked.“We didn’t get that,” the CIO explained. “The cost of just that would have added two or three years and about $3 BILLION to the project according to our analysts.”“As opposed to 8 years, $100 million in project costs, and $48 BILLION in revenue waste,” the CEO interjected. “All before my time, I might add.”Awkward silence, papers rustling…“Where are we bleeding the most money?” the President asked.“Supply chain,” both CEO and CIO answered in unison.“Second and Third?”“Data breaches and legal,” they answered in unison.Awkward silence…“Meet back in 48 hours.”Disconnect beeps…

Veeva Systems is hiring a Senior Software Engineer - SRE.→ Remote → $110K–$270K base → Real production ownership → U.S. timezone onlyIf you’ve ever built and operated systems at scale, you already know: The problems are never just in code. They show up in capacity planning, bad on-call handoffs, and systems nobody understands end to end.This role is different.You will lead incidents. You will build infra from scratch. You will sit side-by-side with engineers and say: “This won’t work at scale—here’s why.”Veeva supports 2M+ users. This is not a toy system. This is real-world complexity. You’re expected to handle it.Tech stack includes: → Java → Spring, Hibernate → Kubernetes, Docker → AWS, MySQL → Git, Maven → Bash, Python, GoIt’s remote, but timezone-limited to PST/HST. They’re serious about being able to hand off problems without delay. That also means: when you're off, you're actually off.If you’ve been looking for a high-trust role where your decisions matter, apply.Not available for India or Pakistan. Available in the US, UK, Brazil, Portugal, Spain, and other European countries. $3 BILLION dollar question from a desperate CIO of a fortune 500 company with the CEO and founder/President on the call - “In the simplest terms, tell me HOW to fix my data so that everything FIRST works, SECONDLY works in real-time; BI, ERP, and AI?”1. Use a senior business analyst and a team of business analysts to document how your business works into BRD, and FRD. (Business Requirements Documentation, and Functional Requirements Documentation)In the BRD also specifically document your competitive edge, how you stay in business, and innovate. How are you different from or better than your competitors?Specifically document how you collect and use intelligence internally and on your competitors. You need a full competitor intelligence database in addition to internal BI.Also, in the BRD, document legal compliance and regulatory reporting requirements.2. Sign-off and deliver the BRD to me, the enterprise data modeler. I’ll make a data model structure that makes your data compatible with modern software, ERP, BI, AI, and automatically follow how your business works. I’ll create data view GUI, insert GUI for data entry, data update GUI, etc.3. The last step is I and an ETL analyst will Create a repeatable ETL process to extract, transform, and load your data. The data model will automatically import and fix data that can be fixed. Bad data will be quarantined for manual data entry repair.AT THIS POINT YOUR DATA IS FIXED, ERP, BI, and AI ready! Response: “So just formally document everything and hand it to you? That’s it?!”“Yes, that’s it,” I responded. “WELL Why haven’t we already done this?” The President asked the CIO.“Cost!” The CEO interjected.“Cost? What are we looking at?” The President asked.“We got three other estimates 8 years ago.” The CIO resumed. “$6 billion from Xerox, $1 Billion from PWC and IBM, and $2,000,000 from the offshore guys we usually use.”Awkward silence for 4 second…“So what the F happened?” The President asked.The CIO slowly responded, “We took the most cost effective option…”“And went over it by over $100 million,” the CEO interjected. “Well we under estimated the analysis requirements, got to the end of the project, and nothing worked,” the CIO finished.“And the data and performance got ten times worse!” The CEO said.“Well what about that automatic data model thing?!” The predident asked.“We didn’t get that,” the CIO explained. “The cost of just that would have added two or three years and about $3 BILLION to the project according to our analysts.”“As opposed to 8 years, $100 million in project costs, and $48 BILLION in revenue waste,” the CEO interjected. “All before my time, I might add.”Awkward silence, papers rustling…“Where are we bleeding the most money?” the President asked.“Supply chain,” both CEO and CIO answered in unison.“Second and Third?”“Data breaches and legal,” they answered in unison.Awkward silence…“Meet back in 48 hours.”Disconnect beeps…
